summary: Ireland is divided into historic counties, which started as Norman areas. Over time, these counties changed, and today there are 32 traditional ones. In 1921, Ireland was divided, and 6 counties became part of Northern Ireland. Now, Northern Ireland uses districts instead of counties for local government. In the Republic of Ireland, some counties have been split, creating 26 counties, 3 cities, and 2 city-counties for local government.
title: Counties of Ireland
